comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

When downloading a file called "mailclub.xex" from googlemail (mail-attachment), I select a file "mailclub.exe" in "save as" dialog to override. I confirm the messagebox to override the existing file. Afterwards the file "mailclub.exe" is deleted and the downloaded file is named "mailclub.exe.xex".

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start to download file
2. In "save as" dialog select existing file to override
3. Select "yes" in confirmation box, if existing file should be overwritten.


Actual Results:  
existing file is deleted & downloaded file has wrong extension

Expected Results:  
existing file should be overridden
comments.author: markus-patt@web.de

comments.creator: markus-patt@web.de

comments.text:
Confirmed.

Firefox appends the server file extension to the file if you type a "malicious" file extension in the "File name:" box, even if you enclose it with quotes. This happens for file extensions exe, hta, js, etc. In my opinion this is wrong because when users purposely enclose the file name that has an extension with quotes, he certainly knows what he is doing. Even more so if he selects the file directly in the explorer-like window above the "File name:" box.
comments.author: limweizhong@gmail.com

comments.author: manuela.muntean@softvision.ro
comments.text:
I can reproduce this issue indeed with Firefox 26 on XP 32-bit.

I followed the next STR:

1. Create on Desktop a .html file named "CNN.com International - Breaking, World, Business, Sports, Entertainment and Video News.html"
2. Open http://edition.cnn.com/
3. Select "Save Page As..."  (the File name you will get is "CNN.com International - Breaking, World, Business, Sports, Entertainment and Video News.htm")
4. From the dialog you are getting select the file created at step 1 

After step 4, "CNN.com International - Breaking, World, Business, Sports, Entertainment and Video News.html" has been deleted from my Desktop. All I can see is the "CNN.com International - Breaking, World, Business, Sports, Entertainment and Video News_files" folder on my Desktop, containg other folders, images, .js files, etc.
comments.raw_text:
I can reproduce this issue indeed with Firefox 26 on XP 32-bit.

I followed the next STR:

1. Create on Desktop a .html file named "CNN.com International - Breaking, World, Business, Sports, Entertainment and Video News.html"
2. Open http://edition.cnn.com/
3. Select "Save Page As..."  (the File name you will get is "CNN.com International - Breaking, World, Business, Sports, Entertainment and Video News.htm")
4. From the dialog you are getting select the file created at step 1 

After step 4, "CNN.com International - Breaking, World, Business, Sports, Entertainment and Video News.html" has been deleted from my Desktop. All I can see is the "CNN.com International - Breaking, World, Business, Sports, Entertainment and Video News_files" folder on my Desktop, containg other folders, images, .js files, etc.
